column1: ID System: 1-4 Family Residential Net Loans and Leases

column4: The number of institutions represented in that column of data.  This number is used primarily for peer group data.

Total loans secured by 1-4 family residential properties (including revolving and open-end loans) held in domestic offices. Note:Prior to 2004 the savings institutions that file a thrift financial report did not report the 1-4 family loans by the sub category first liens and second liens. The data is not available prior to this year.  Commercial banks began reporting that data in 1991

column2: Loans Secured By 1-4 Family First Liens
column4: Closed-end loans secured by first liens on 1-4 family residential properties and held in domestic offices. Note:Prior to 2004 the savings institutions that file a thrift financial report did not report the 1-4 family loans by the sub category first liens and second liens. The data is not available prior to this year.  Commercial banks began reporting that data in 1991.

column2: Loans Secured By 1-4 Family Junior Liens
column4: Closed-end loans secured by junior liens on 1-4 family residential properties and held in domestic offices. Note: Prior to 2004 the savings institutions that file a thrift financial report did not report the 1-4 family loans by the sub category first liens and second liens. The data is not available prior to this year.  Commercial banks began reporting that data in 1991.
Open-end loans secured by 1-4 family residential properties extended as lines of credit in domestic offices (included in total 1-4 mortgage loans).

column2: Adjustable Rate Loans Secured By 1-4 Family Residential (Memoranda)
column4: All other adjustable rate closed-end loans secured by 1-4family residential properties, secured by first liens, andheld in domestic offices Listed as memoranda only and is included in real estate 1-4 family-first liens.     This item is not available for   TFR Reporters  .
